description: A collection of circles in a wide ovular formation with two triangular formations extending from the bottom; the left triangular formation is thin while the right one is wider with a curved point. Each circle has a different number in the center denoting how many lines stem from that point. There is a dark pink triangle to the left of the center of the formation and a dark red triangle at the edge of the ovular formation and the right triangular formation.

author.name: VertexArchive
author.description: An UNOFFICIAL archive of the New York Times' Vertex puzzle. This account is not affiliated with the NY Times. I just like the triangles.
